metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 1
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: According to the IBC data released in August 2025, how many companies have been successfully resolved under the framework as of March 31, 2025?
questions.explanation: As of March 31, 2025, a total of 1,194 companies have been successfully resolved under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) framework, enabling creditors to realize an amount of ₹3.89 lakh crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules, which new class of companies was enabled for fast-track merger procedure through the amendment on 4th September, 2025?

options.B: A holding company and its subsidiary where the transferor is a listed company
options.C: Any two or more Section 8 companies
options.D: Two or more unlisted companies which meet prescribed thresholds of outstanding loans, debentures or deposits
options.E: A foreign company merging with an unrelated Indian company

questions.explanation: The CAA Rules were amended on 4th September, 2025, to include additional classes for fast-track merger. One of these new classes is 'Two or more unlisted companies (other than section 8 companies) which meet prescribed thresholds of outstanding loans, debentures or deposits'.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In March 2025, India strengthened its global trade and diplomatic ties on two separate fronts. Which of the following statements correctly identifies these two key international developments?

options.A: Signed a Free Trade Agreement with the UK and joined the RCEP.
options.B: Signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union and witnessed the expansion of BRICS membership.
options.C: Initiated the India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor (IMEC) and signed a Bilateral Investment Treaty with the USA.
options.D: Signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union and was admitted as the 39th member of the OECD.
options.E: Narrowed the trade deficit with China and hosted the G20 Summit.

questions.explanation: The current affairs content for March 2025 specifically mentions two distinct events: India signing a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union, and the expansion of the BRICS group to include new members like Saudi Arabia and the UAE.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the rate of the "Health and Education Cess on income-tax" to be levied on the amount of income-tax and surcharge?
questions.explanation: As per sub-section (11) of Section 2 of the Finance Bill, the amount of income-tax and surcharge shall be further increased by an additional surcharge called the 'Health and Education Cess on income-tax', calculated at the rate of four per cent. (Page 31)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The National Quantum Mission, launched to foster R&D in quantum technology, was allocated a specific fund. What was the total outlay for this mission and over how many years will it be implemented?
questions.explanation: The Government of India launched the National Quantum Mission in September 2025 with a total financial allocation of ₹6,000 crore to be implemented over a period of 5 years.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the assessment year 2025-26, what is the surcharge rate on income tax for a firm or local authority whose total income exceeds one crore rupees?
questions.explanation: In the case of every firm or local authority with a total income exceeding one crore rupees, the income tax shall be increased by a surcharge calculated at the rate of twelve per cent. (Page 13, 85, 86)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In May 2025, India's economy achieved a significant milestone by surpassing which country to become the world's 3rd largest with a GDP of $4.5 trillion?
questions.explanation: The current affairs content for May 2025 states that India became the world's 3rd largest economy with a GDP of $4.5 trillion, surpassing Japan.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The time limit for issuing a notice for income escaping assessment under Section 148 has been revised. A notice can be issued if up to five years and three months have elapsed, provided the escaped income is likely to amount to or exceed a certain threshold. What is this threshold?
questions.explanation: The substituted Section 149(1)(b) allows for a notice to be issued if three years and three months, but not more than five years and three months, have elapsed from the end of the relevant assessment year, provided the Assessing Officer has evidence that the income chargeable to tax which has escaped assessment amounts to or is likely to amount to fifty lakh rupees or more. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The eligibility period for claiming tax deductions on certain incomes for units in an International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) involved in leasing aircraft or ships under Section 80LA has been extended. What is the new deadline for commencement of operations for such units?
questions.explanation: Clause 19 amends Section 80LA(2)(d) by extending the deadline for commencement of operation for a unit in an IFSC leasing aircraft or ships from 31st March 2025 to 31st March 2030. (Page 43, Page 149)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to section 80CCD, what is the maximum annual deduction allowed to a parent or guardian for contributions made to the National Pension Scheme account of a minor?
questions.explanation: Clause 17 inserts a new proviso in section 80CCD(1B) to allow a deduction for payment or deposit made to the account of a minor under the pension scheme, subject to a maximum aggregate amount of fifty thousand rupees. (Page 42, Page 148)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 years and above in 2023-24, according to the annual Periodic Labour Force Survey (PLFS) report?
questions.explanation: The unemployment rate for individuals aged 15 years and above has steadily declined from 6 per cent in 2017-18 to 3.2 per cent in 2023-24, as per the 2023-24 annual PLFS report. (Page 76)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on NITI Aayog's analysis, approximately how many crore people are estimated to have escaped multidimensional poverty between 2015-16 and 2019-21?
questions.explanation: The analysis shows a sharp decline in multidimensional poverty, with an estimated 13.5 crore Indians escaping it between 2015-16 and 2019-21, putting India on track to achieve SDG Target 1.2 well ahead of 2030. (Page 265)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) in its meeting held from August 4-6, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) unanimously voted to keep the policy repo rate under the liquidity adjustment facility (LAF) unchanged at 5.50 per cent.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the income tax rate for total income from Rs. 4,00,001 to Rs. 8,00,000 for individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) for the assessment year 2026-27?
questions.explanation: The amendment to Section 115BAC specifies a tax rate of 5 per cent for total income ranging from Rs. 4,00,001 to Rs. 8,00,000, effective from the assessment year 2026-27. (Page 46)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Several key appointments were made to lead financial institutions between late 2024 and mid-2025. Which of the following leadership appointments occurred in the first quarter of 2025 (Jan-Mar)?

options.A: Sanjay Malhotra took charge as the Governor of RBI.
options.B: CS Setty was appointed as the new Chairman of State Bank of India.
options.C: Atul Bheda was appointed as the Chairman of SEBI.
options.D: Madhabi Puri Buch was reappointed as Chairperson of SEBI.
options.E: Dinesh Kumar Khara was reappointed as Chairman of State Bank of India.

questions.explanation: Atul Bheda was appointed as the Chairman of SEBI in February 2025. Sanjay Malhotra's appointment was in Dec 2024 (though he took charge in Jan 2025, the appointment was earlier). CS Setty's appointment was in Sep 2025, Madhabi Puri Buch's reappointment was in May 2025, and Dinesh Khara's reappointment was in Nov 2024. Therefore, only Atul Bheda's appointment falls within the Q1 2025 timeframe.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected Gross NPA (GNPA) ratio for Scheduled Commercial Banks by September 2024 if the macroeconomic environment deteriorates into a severe stress scenario?
questions.explanation: Macro stress tests indicate that if the macroeconomic environment worsens to a severe stress scenario, the GNPA ratio for all SCBs may rise from 3.2 per cent to 4.4 per cent by September 2024. (Page 91)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What amount of Gross Market Borrowing does the Government of India plan for the second half of FY 2025-26, including issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds?
questions.explanation: The Government of India plans to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore in the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26 (H2: FY 2025-26) through dated securities, which includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Effective from the assessment year beginning 1st April 2026, what will be the income tax rate for individuals under the new tax regime (Section 115BAC) for the income slab of Rs. 8,00,001 to Rs. 12,00,000?
questions.explanation: Clause 24 amends Section 115BAC, introducing a new tax table. For the income slab from Rs. 8,00,001 to Rs. 12,00,000, the applicable rate of tax is 10 per cent. (Page 46)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India and ADB signed a $125 million loan agreement in September 2025 to upgrade urban services in which Indian state?
questions.explanation: The Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a $125 million loan agreement to enhance urban livability and bolster climate resilience in six district headquarters and Guwahati, in the State of Assam.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Following the Monetary Policy Committee meeting in February 2025, what was the revised policy repo rate?
questions.explanation: The MPC decided to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points from 6.50 per cent to 6.25 per cent in the February 2025 meeting. (Page 112, 115)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To enhance credit availability for small and marginal farmers, the RBI has increased the limit for collateral-free agriculture loans. What is the newly enhanced limit per borrower?
questions.explanation: Taking into account the rise in agricultural input costs and overall inflation since the last revision in 2019, it has been decided to increase the limit for collateral-free agriculture loans from ₹1.6 lakh to ₹2 lakh per borrower. (Page 13, 22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In the October 2024 Statement on Developmental and Regulatory Policies, what was the announced enhancement for the UPI Lite wallet limit?
questions.explanation: To encourage wider adoption of UPI, it was decided to increase the UPI Lite wallet limit from ₹2,000 to ₹5,000 and the per-transaction limit from ₹500 to ₹1,000. (Pages 14, 22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The compounded quarterly growth rate (CQGR) of India's deseasonalised quarterly GDP was higher in the post-pandemic period (Q3FY21 - Q4FY24) compared to the pre-pandemic period (Q1FY12 - Q4FY20). What were these respective growth rates?
questions.explanation: Analysis reveals that the compounded quarterly growth rate (CQGR) of deseasonalised quarterly GDP was greater in the period Q3 FY21 – Q4 FY24 at 1.9% than the CQGR of 1.5% in the pre-pandemic period of Q1 FY12 – Q4 FY20. (Table I.1, page 63)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Finance Bill proposes a change in the TDS rate for income in respect of investment in a securitisation trust under Section 194LBC. What is the new uniform TDS rate?
questions.explanation: Clause 63 amends section 194LBC to substitute the varying rates of 25% or 30% with a uniform TDS rate of ten per cent. (Page 57, Page 168)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its February 2025 meeting, what was the policy repo rate set by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC)?
questions.explanation: The MPC unanimously voted to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points from 6.50 per cent to 6.25 per cent in its February 2025 meeting. This was the first rate reduction since February 2023. (Page 89, 112, 115)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: During the monetary tightening cycle from May 2022 to March 2024, by how many basis points did the weighted average domestic term deposit rate (WADTDR) on outstanding term deposits increase?
questions.explanation: In the tightening cycle from May 2022 to March 2024, the WADTDR on outstanding term deposits increased by 185 basis points. During the same period, the policy repo rate was increased by 250 bps. (Page 115, Table III.4)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The second advance estimates (SAE) placed real GDP growth for Q3:2023-24 at what level, outpacing consensus forecasts?
questions.explanation: Real GDP growth for Q3:2023-24 was placed at 8.4 per cent, underpinned by strong investment and an improvement in private consumption. (Page 11)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: During the monetary policy tightening period from May 2022 to December 2024, the repo rate increased by 250 basis points. In this context, which statement accurately compares the monetary policy transmission to fresh deposits and fresh rupee loans between Public Sector Banks (PSBs) and Private Sector Banks (PVBs)?

options.A: Transmission to fresh deposit rates was higher in PVBs, while transmission to fresh lending rates was higher in PSBs.
options.B: PSBs demonstrated higher transmission than PVBs in both fresh deposit rates and fresh lending rates.
options.C: PVBs showed stronger transmission than PSBs across both fresh deposit and fresh lending rates.
options.D: Transmission to fresh lending rates was higher in PVBs, while transmission to fresh deposit rates was higher in PSBs.
options.E: Both bank groups experienced identical transmission in fresh deposit rates, but PSBs had a lower transmission in fresh lending rates.

questions.explanation: During the May 2022 to December 2024 period, Public Sector Banks (PSBs) showed a higher transmission of the policy rate hike. The Weighted Average Domestic Term Deposit Rate (WADTDR) on fresh deposits increased by 274 bps for PSBs compared to 214 bps for Private Sector Banks (PVBs). Similarly, the Weighted Average Lending Rate (WALR) on fresh rupee loans increased by 177 bps for PSBs versus 163 bps for PVBs. (Page 62, Charts IV.11 and IV.12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: For the purposes of the Direct Tax Vivad se Vishwas Scheme, 2024, what is the 'specified date' on which appeals or applications must be pending?
questions.explanation: Section 89(n) of the scheme defines 'specified date' as the 22nd day of July, 2024. (Page 83)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the estimated growth rate for the industrial sector in FY25?
questions.explanation: The industrial sector is estimated to grow by 6.2 per cent in FY25, supported by strong growth in construction and electricity. (Page 56)
questions.subject: General_Awareness
